newsitem.title: USA: Hudson Tech stumped by shr price decline.
newsitem.headline: Hudson Tech stumped by shr price decline.

text.p: Hudson Technologies Inc said it did not know the reason behind its recent share price decline and that there were no pending announcements except for its third-quarter earnings release in mid-October.

Hudson President and Chief Executive Officer Kevin Zugibe said in a statement, "It is true that sales in the first half of the year did not compare favorably to the same period in 1995, but 1995 sales were helped substantially by the sale of imported refrigerants that the company reclaimed and resold."
This business had been discontinued, he said, and second half 1996 sales should show a more positive growth comparison.
The company said it discontinued the business to emphasize its higher-margin reclamation business and focus on the domestic market.
Comparisons excluding those sales showed substantial growth, Zugibe said.
Hudson Technologies provides refrigerant reclamation and management programs and refrigerant sales.
